content.description: Climb the graffitied face with lots of good options for holds. For full value, eliminate the arete behind you for stemming.
content.location: It ascends the face on the boulder in the corner and is #1 on the beta topo photo.

content.description:
"Start low on a shelf, then traverse left and then up at the end." 

  Sit start.  

  Going straight up on jugs at the left side of the shelf reduces difficulty to V0. To maintain value, trend left and up after the shelf peters out (crux).
content.protection: None, use a pad for the topout.
content.location: Look right before getting into the alcove. Start on the prominent shelf at stomach-height right of the entrance canyon.

content.description:
"Sit start on diagonal crimps and move up and left to sidepulls." 

  The first few moves are the crux, the topout is mellow. It is an enjoyable climb.
content.protection: A pad and a spotter for the rock.
content.location: Look to your right coming through the little canyon feature that serves as the alcove entrace. The diagonal crimps are hard to miss.

content.description: Sit start the "right wall" at a angled rail. Traverse right and around the corner into overhung territory. Use a tricky hand sequence to get through the overhang, make easier moves to gain the flake further right, and top out. This is one of the longer problems in the area. It is also possible to continue the traverse along the flake to make it longer.
content.location: Facing the main alcove wall, turn right.

content.description: Stand start, and climb straight up through an obvious break and jugs.
content.location: It is just right of the arete and is #2 on the beta topo photo.

content.description: Half Moon is one of the better problems on this section. Stand start with left on a cobble hole sidepull that resembles a crescent moon. Move up through a couple obvious holes, and top out right where the horizontal break ends.
content.location: It is #5 on the beta topo photo.

content.description: This is probably the best warm-up problem on this little wall. Start as for Knobs, V0 but traverse right along the shelf once you hit it, and top out when it ends. It is given V1 in the Kemple guidebook, but it’s pretty soft for that, no harder than its neighbors. The traverse adds some length, but it’s all jugs with good feet.
content.location: Do the same start as Knobs, V0, then traverse right at the break.  It is #3 on the beta topo photo.

content.description: Stand start just left of the blunt arete in the middle of the wall. Climb sloping cobbles to the top.
content.location: It is a few feet right of Half Moon, V0, on the blunted arete and is #6 on the beta topo photo.

content.description: Start with your left hand on a cobble pinch and your right hand on your choice of small holds. Move up on cobbles through the break, and top out.
content.location: It is about 6’ from the left end of the wall and is #4 on the beta topo photo.

content.description: This is the shorter, less steep wall forming the right side of The Alcove. It is peppered with good warm-ups and beginner problems, with enough variations to last all day.
